meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - I'm back with another groovy review, and this time it's all about Humanity! *puts on sunglasses*

Okay, let me get straight to the point. Humanity is a puzzle game that will have you dancing like a hippie at Woodstock. It's like Lemmings meets... well, humanity, but in a good way! The premise is simple: you're these tiny humans trying to navigate the world and solve puzzles to reach the end of each level. Sounds easy, right? Wrong! These little dudes have some big plans, and it takes some serious groovy skills to get 'em there.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "What about all those other critics?" Ah, my friends, they're just like me, trying to find the perfect groove in this puzzle party. IGN thinks Humanity is a beautiful, modern reimagining of Lemmings (same here, yo!), GameSpot says it's a charming, engaging, and inviting puzzle adventure that'll suck you in for hours (totally agreed!). And don't even get me started on Game Informer - they're all about the imaginative experience and those "clicky electronic beats" (um, yeah, I'm down for some funky tunes while puzzling!).

Vandal is like the cool kid on the block who says Humanity is a fantastic puzzle game that'll remind you of those old-school Dreamcast titles (heyyyy, nostalgia!). And GamingTrend? They're all about how Humanity is vast, clever, inventive, and eclectic - basically, a grand design of puzzle mechanics that's super fun to experiment with (yaaas, sign me up!).

Last but not least, COGconnected says Humanity is weird and wonderful (same here, fam!), with some minor hiccups like difficulty spikes and hint systems. God is a Geek agrees it's an expertly crafted puzzler that gives you freedom to reach your goals - yessss!

So there you have it, folks! All these critics are basically saying the same thing: Humanity is one groovy puzzle game that'll keep you coming back for more (and maybe even inspire some creativity in you, like those little humans). Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm off to solve some puzzles and get my hippie on!

Stay curious, stay puzzled, and remember - Hippo Penny says Humanity is the bee's knees!
